definition: to formally call on/to worship (a God)/to pay homage to sb
to take part in/to participate/to join/to attend/to counsel/unequal/varied/irregular/uneven/not uniform/abbr. for 參議院|参议院 Senate, Upper House
variant of 參|参[shen1]
ginseng/one of the 28 constellations
old variant of 參|参[can1]
variant of 參|参[shen1]
to pay respect/worship/visit/salute

sentences.english: Mr Fukuda, by contrast, has a family legacy to enshrine.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，福田康夫有参拜神庙的家庭传统。

sentences.english: Tea will be exciting live show and the Buddha Tooth Relic shrine activities.
sentences.chinese: 现场将进行精彩的茶艺展示和佛牙参拜活动。

sentences.english: Will Premier Wen press Abe to make commitment of not visiting the Yasukuni Shrine?
sentences.chinese: 温家宝总理是否会让安倍作出不参拜靖国神社的承诺？

sentences.english: The key point of the worship is negating history and justifying Japan's military aggression.
sentences.chinese: 而参拜靖国神社就是为了把军国主义侵略史正当化。

sentences.english: How many post-war Japanese prime ministers have visited the Yasukuni Shrine?
sentences.chinese: 战后日本有多少首相曾去靖国神社参拜？

sentences.english: The Japanese leaders insisted on visiting the Yasukuni Shrine that worships Class-A war criminals during World War II.
sentences.chinese: 日本领导人坚持参拜供奉甲级战犯的靖国神社。

sentences.english: Many pilgrims worship at the shrine.
It seem that each time a Japanese backbencher MP visits a shrine, relations goes sour. Stupid.
sentences.chinese: 每次日本议员参拜神社，两国关系就会变冷。

sentences.english: Wong Tai Sin Temple is one of the most worshipped temples in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 黄大仙祠是香港最多人参拜及占卜的庙宇之一。

sentences.english: "We don't usually open this to public worship," she was told.
sentences.chinese: “我们很少把它对公众参拜者开放”，康被告知。

to worship/to make customary deferences to/a pilgrimage
to bow in salute/to kowtow
to visit/to pay one's respects to (a revered figure etc)/to pay homage (at a tomb etc)
to offer sacrifice (to one's ancestors)
to kneel three times and kowtow nine times (formal etiquette on meeting the emperor)
to worship/to observe religious rites/to pay one's respects (to one's ancestors etc)
to pay a formal visit/to call to pay respects/to pay homage (at a monument, mausoleum etc)
to pay a formal visit/to call to pay respects/to meet one's senior or superior
to burn incense at a temple
to consecrate/to enshrine and worship/an offering (to one's ancestors)/a sacrifice (to a God)
to kowtow/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
burn incense
Yasukuni Shrine, Shinto shrine in Tokyo to Japanese war dead, controversial as burial ground of several Class A war criminals
to salute/to make one's salutations
